name: Prohibited policy plans
text:
§431:10D-116  Prohibited policy plans.  No life insurer shall issue for delivery or deliver in this State any life insurance policy:
     (1)  Issued under any plan for the segregation of policyholders into mathematical groups and providing benefits for a surviving policyholder of a group arising out of the death of another policyholder of such group, or under any other similar plan.
     (2)  Providing benefits or values for surviving or continuing policyholders contingent upon the lapse or termination of the policies of other policyholders, whether by death or otherwise. [L 1987, c 347, pt of §2]
